Name: Improper disposal of recyclable material at one- and two-family dwellings.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to improper disposal of recyclable material at one- and two-family dwellings.
BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section 1.  Section 16-324 of the administrative code of the city of New York as added by local law 19 of the year 1989, is amended by adding new subdivision c to read as follows:
	c.	Not withstanding any other provision of law, for a violation of this chapter or any rule or regulation promulgated pursuant thereto, to be issued to the owner of a one-or two-family dwelling for the improper disposal of household waste, a minimum of five items of recyclable, non-recyclable or missorted recyclable material must be identified at the site by an enforcement agent to be in the incorrect receptacle.
Â§2.	This local law shall take effect immediately. 

Int 548-2005
CJC
